preqs: Students must have passed ETC1000 or must be enrolled in course 3822 or 4412.

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ETC1000} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ECC2440, ETF2700, MTH2010, MTH2021}
For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {3822, 4412} Do Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ETC1000} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} Otherwise true
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ECC2440, ETF2700, MTH2010, MTH2021}

proh: ETF2700, ECC2440. Students are also prohibited from enrolling in ETC2440 if they have passed both MTH2010 and MTH2021.
description: This unit introduces mathematical techniques that are invaluable tools for econometrics, economics, finance, and business. Topics covered include matrix algebra, linear simultaneous equations and the LU decomposition, eigenvalues and the Schur decomposition, random vectors; optimisation, including the Lagrange multiplier method, partial differentiation, multiple integration, difference and differential equations. Some emphasis will be given to the use of computer programs for performing matrix calculations.
